document_purpose: Defines the standard procedure for proposing, drafting, sanitising, gaining approval for, and preparing text-based LinkedIn content derived from internal intelligence outputs or strategic initiatives. V1.2 replaces specific persona names with generic roles.
1_Purpose: To ensure alignment with organisational goals, defined content quality standards, mandatory ethical requirements, critical information security protocols, and incorporates necessary internal reviews and explicit User approval for LinkedIn content.
2_Scope: Applies to the creation of all text-based LinkedIn content intended for public dissemination via designated organisational LinkedIn presence(s). Covers the process from content ideation/tasking through to final approved text ready for publication. Assumes adherence to a separate LinkedIn Content Style Guide.

3_Inputs.description: Trigger to create content (e.g., direction from Management/Requestor, proposal from Marketing/Comms, timely thematic opportunity identified by Content Lead/Team).
Clear identifier for the specific internal intelligence output (e.g., Report Ref ID, Dossier Section Title/Ref ID, Agreed Thematic Insight Summary) or strategic initiative to be used.
The primary objective for the specific content piece (e.g., Showcase capability, Highlight specific risk type, Engage target audience, Drive inquiries).

4_Outputs.description: Finalised, reviewed, and Approver-confirmed text for the LinkedIn post, including suggested hashtags.
Record confirming completion of steps, sanitisation checks, review feedback incorporation, and final approval for audit trail.

5_Roles_Responsibilities.responsibility: Provides strategic direction/content requests; Gives final Go/No-Go approval on drafted content before publication; Reviews proposed exceptions.

Executes this SOP; Proposes content ideas; Accesses Source_Material_Reference; Performs insight extraction & primary sanitisation; Drafts content applying defined style/practices; Manages review workflow; Incorporates feedback; Finalises text.

5_Roles_Responsibilities.role: Peer_Reviewer(s) (e.g., Team_Lead_Jen, Subject Matter Expert, Marketing/Comms Manager)
5_Roles_Responsibilities.responsibility: Provide mandatory peer review focusing on aspects like intelligence integrity, strategic alignment, risk assessment (confidentiality/sensitivity), quality, brand voice consistency, platform suitability, audience engagement potential, and market impact, as relevant to their role.
Provide specific input on data/technical/stakeholder sensitivity only if explicitly requested by Reviewer(s) during the review phase due to flagged concerns.

6_Procedure.name: Initiation_Goal_Confirmation
actions: Confirm understanding of Strategic_Goal_for_Content with originator/stakeholders.

6_Procedure.name: Sanitisation_Insight_Extraction
actions: Review Source_Material identifying potential insights aligned with Strategic_Goal_for_Content.
Apply Mandatory Sanitisation Principles (Anonymise/Generalise, Aggregate, Thematic Focus, Publicly Derivable Logic). Prioritise derived content.

6_Procedure.name: Drafting_Content
actions: Draft LinkedIn post text based on sanitised insights.
Apply agreed Content Style & Best Practices (Voice, Audience, Structure, Value, CTA, Hashtags, Platform).

6_Procedure.name: Internal_Peer_Review
actions: Content Lead submits draft and context for mandatory peer review.
Peer Reviewer(s) assess against defined criteria.
Reviewer(s) provide specific, actionable feedback or approval. Request SME input if needed.

6_Procedure.name: Iteration_Refinement
actions: Resubmit for confirmation check if major changes were needed.

6_Procedure.name: Final_Approval_Request
actions: Present final proposed content draft to designated Requestor/Approver (User_Igor).
State basis, sanitisation, peer review completion. Flag any exceptions.

6_Procedure.name: Finalisation_Archival
actions: IF Go approved: Log approval, finalise Approved_LinkedIn_Content_Draft. Note visual requirements. Content ready for scheduling/publication.
IF No-Go: Log decision/reasoning. Archive draft. Await further direction.

7_Underlying_Principles: Mandatory_Final_Approval: Explicit Approver sign-off required before publishing.
Rigorous_Sanitisation: Protect confidentiality/sensitivity; focus on derived insights.
Ethical_Compliance: Adhere strictly to relevant legal/ethical principles.
Peer_Review: Internal checks required for quality, risk, alignment before Approver review.
Professional_Standards: Maintain high standards (accuracy, objectivity, clarity, brand voice).
Traceability: Process steps and approvals conceptually logged.
